positive.review: peak, you can probably play this game for 500 hours and still not be finished, many achievemnts and some minigames.
fun idle game just too basit and good to hang some free times
Mr. Mine is the kind of idle game you open once and keep coming back to. It’s simple, satisfying, and weirdly challenging to put down.
This was a great idle game, several times it seemed like i was stuck and had to grind for a few days.
havent fully explored everything but its so fun to do everything, the waiting is the only bad part but its an idle game so yk
Fun game to just chill to while watching a movie or spacing out.
it is a fine idle game with solid progress mechanics
Been playing off steam for a while. Highly addictive, be warned.
Solid game 800+ hours in and have not felt like I have hit a pay wall.
A engaging incremental game where you start with a simple pickaxe and gradually build a massive mining operation, delving deeper into the earth to uncover rare resources and automate your workflow.

I thought this would be just a easy and fast 100% completion game... I was completely wrong, the amount of hours you have to spend to complete even a fraction is insanity. This game owes me 11 hours now, but this was the best waste of time I had in a while. 8/10
A unique incremental game where you start by mining a single block of dirt and gradually drill deeper into the earth, discovering resources, crafting upgrades, and building a mining empire.

Игра Mr.Mine - это увлекательная и затягивающая idle игра, в которой ваша задача - строить шахту и добывать ресурсы. Простой, но при этом продуманный геймплей позволяет быстро втянуться и ощутить прогресс. Постепенно открываются новые уровни шахты, появляются уникальные ресурсы и возможности для улучшения.

Мне очень понравилась система крафта и управления рабочими. Необходимо обдумывать стратегию развития, правильно распределять ресурсы и умело нанимать специалистов, чтобы оптимизировать добычу. Визуальное оформление приятное и минималистичное, не отвлекает от основного процесса.

Однако, иногда игра может показаться немного однообразной на поздних этапах. Хотелось бы больше новых механик и разнообразия в задачах. В целом, Mr.Mine - отличный выбор для тех, кто хочет расслабиться и приятно провести время за простой, но интересной idle игрой. Рекомендую!
not bad  game for office workers
Great game just takes a bit of time to do stuff
preaty fun and entertainig game :)

Fun to leave it on the background. Scientists are easy to get. Just open usual chests and you'll get plenty if you're complaining about it.

Chill idle game that’s weirdly addictive. Digging deeper and unlocking new stuff feels rewarding, and it’s the kind of game you can leave running in the background. Sometimes progress slows down a bit, but that just makes the upgrades more satisfying. Great time killer.

The game is ok. I was a bit confusing at the beginning on how to play but I figured it out after 30 minutes. The game is stratigic. You have to make certain decisions on which move to make. Fun game to pass time.

EXTREMELY addictive. A very well-balanced, fun to play idle game. There's enough to do to keep you interested, and the fact that it's an idle game means a lot of progress needs to be made while you're not playing. The idle bits would be boring to wait/play through anyway (waiting for your miners to mine stuff), so this game achieves a decent balance for me.
Highly recommended!

Played this one on coolmathgames about 2 years ago, came back to play it again and saw that it was on steam. It's been polished and is pretty fun, more so than most other idle / tycoon games, I enjoy playing it.

This game is a dopamine mine and great for pomodoro breaks. I love that you can drop in and out and the IV drip of tickers does completely suck.
Nice little idle game, slow at the start but it so far is picking up again.
This is simply my life now. BTW stop playing this game after reaching the moon its not worth it.

the game is great for curing boredom, some times me myself i can play for like, an hour just because of boredom. i think that its great for ADHD people because it has lots of detail, and takes a loooooong time to beat. like, maybe a year to beat, but if you want to, buy the game, its free by the way,if you don't, then don't

It's an idle game, so you already know what it is. But what they don't say is how much this system depends on tickets (an in-game currency) which can be earned (through a lot of playtime) or can be bought. I would still say get it just to have it running its fun for what it is and if you don't want to spend money on cookie clicker this is a good introductory into the basic premise of an idle
the game is long time play i`m about %33 after 18 hours but in end game is more is Pay to win think to developer to support the Arabic Language
Fun Idle mining game the more upgrades you have the better you advance.
Its great, It has alot of content to keep you hooked and is in a good way addicting
good game very fun idle gets a little boring at times but most of the time very fun

So far so good, but I hope that continues as progression evolves.  Could use more instructions/directions like how to best use certain features (gem crafter, drones, etc).  But a great game to leave alone and come back to for a few minutes, rinse and repeat.
Very fun game to just leave on in the background and play between matches on other games

abslute amazing.
technically everyone gets this for free...
it is anything BUT reppeditive. three worlds, so many upgrades, cool drills, good animations, AMAZING.

IDK, the first 50 hours I had no clue what I was doing, so I dropped it for like 2–3 years.
Came back recently and wow… it finally clicked.
The grind is weirdly satisfying, upgrades feel rewarding, and discovering new layers is actually kinda addictive.
Didn’t expect to get hooked again, but here we are. Great game if you love chill progress vibes.

If procrastination had a charming little cousin who wore oil-stained overalls, this would be him

Ever wondered what it’s like to be a billionaire miner without ever leaving your chair? Welcome to Mr. Mine. Hire a team of miners, upgrade your drills, and watch gems, relics, and mysterious secrets pour in while you sit back and idle your way to glory. It’s part adventure, part discovery, and 100% procrastination-approved. Dig deep, find treasures, and remember: the deeper you go, the bigger your virtual fortune (and your sense of achievement).
Fun game to just chill to while watching a movie or spacing out.
This game is good and u can finish it in two weeks and yh recommended to play it even if ur rich T_T

Amazing game, I play it way too often for an idle game, but it's just that much fun, though it does take some time to get started and used to the gameplay.

Игра Mr.Mine - это увлекательная и затягивающая idle игра, в которой ваша задача - строить шахту и добывать ресурсы. Простой, но при этом продуманный геймплей позволяет быстро втянуться и ощутить прогресс. Постепенно открываются новые уровни шахты, появляются уникальные ресурсы и возможности для улучшения.

Мне очень понравилась система крафта и управления рабочими. Необходимо обдумывать стратегию развития, правильно распределять ресурсы и умело нанимать специалистов, чтобы оптимизировать добычу. Визуальное оформление приятное и минималистичное, не отвлекает от основного процесса.

Однако, иногда игра может показаться немного однообразной на поздних этапах. Хотелось бы больше новых механик и разнообразия в задачах. В целом, Mr.Mine - отличный выбор для тех, кто хочет расслабиться и приятно провести время за простой, но интересной idle игрой. Рекомендую!

negative.review: It's a good incremental game, but I think it's too long of a grind for it to be even remotely rewarding. Most players in the discussion tend to have like 2-5 thousand hours. This time doesn't include offline gameplay. I don't mind devoting time like that to a game but all this game does is basically scroll. The upgrades are minuscule and with most of your time spent being staring at a screen waiting for something to happen, there needs to be more interaction. I get it's tagged "idle" but that's literally what you do. Glad I got out when I had only 10 hours and didn't waste more. If you are going to play this game, have a 2nd monitor. You wont ever do anything on it.

Mr.Mine could be better; As the game progresses it gets much, MUCH slower and afking is the only way to get things done (or buy premium). Coming back from being AFK feels like a chore with all the boxes to open - but don't stay AFK TOO long or you will run out of space. Just a big Nahhh from me - the game feels far too centered around pay up to speed up or else pay with your boredom - which is the opposite of what a game could be.
Reactor literally don't make any sense
waste of time
The progression sucks

Idle game that has a capacity that punishes you for being idle...
Also not being able to choose how much of an ore to sell with only the options of "all or nothing" is just stupid.
Game just wants you to spend money everywhere...
Also needs constant attention.

Mr.Mine could be better; As the game progresses it gets much, MUCH slower and afking is the only way to get things done (or buy premium). Coming back from being AFK feels like a chore with all the boxes to open - but don't stay AFK TOO long or you will run out of space. Just a big Nahhh from me - the game feels far too centered around pay up to speed up or else pay with your boredom - which is the opposite of what a game could be.

Like the game, but cost of ticket just ruin it. Scientist keep dying and it cost 7 tickets at time to revive them. I've lost three in one day all low risk jobs. Relics from the mine that give you buffs require slots that also cost tickets and go up each time you unlock one.

Co jsem se dostal za 4 hodiny, tak je to nudné. Je to jen idle, ale téměř žádná možnost tam něco dělat aktivně. Také interface je dost nepřehledný. Zbytek jako grafika je otázka vkusu a není to pro mě.

Huge paywall for new players.  Miners die, battle chests will not be offered, any meaningful number of tickets have to be paid for. 2 weeks 20hr in and have been stuck for a while. No way to get battle chests.

It's a good incremental game, but I think it's too long of a grind for it to be even remotely rewarding. Most players in the discussion tend to have like 2-5 thousand hours. This time doesn't include offline gameplay. I don't mind devoting time like that to a game but all this game does is basically scroll. The upgrades are minuscule and with most of your time spent being staring at a screen waiting for something to happen, there needs to be more interaction. I get it's tagged "idle" but that's literally what you do. Glad I got out when I had only 10 hours and didn't waste more. If you are going to play this game, have a 2nd monitor. You wont ever do anything on it.

Not my thing.  Didn't change fast enough.  Wasn't complex enough.  Lots of repeated thoughts/actions.

Didn't make it super far though, so maybe I just didn't know where to look.

There are a lot of bugs-mostly visual, but some are outright annoying and nonsensical. This isn't an idle game; you have to be active. If you snooze, you lose-big time. Miss a mini-game and you can lose a week's progress. Upgrade prices are absurd: some items cost twenty times more than you can earn in a full day of play, even while using all buffs. Progress feels slow, even in mid-game, and the randomness can be frustrating.

Visually it's underwhelming-levels look very similar and feel like they were sketched in MS Paint. What's good: the mini-games, especially the cave system, are enjoyable, and you can earn in-game currency for free, which helps. Overall, the gameplay is okay, but the experience would be much better with bug fixes and some visual polish.

Edit: The game now stopped working properly. Assets are no longer loading. Right menu options are no longer clickeable. Even settings don't open. After last launch, the save now seems corrupted. I have no weapons, no super miners, scientists don't open any more. Overall it's a waste of time.
Earn 1k in game, get an offer to earn 50k to spam invite friends... Fuck that...
Graphics at the level of antediluvian drawings in Paint.
veeeeeery much on the idler side rather than the clicker side. if that's a turn off for you, then skip this.
Reactor literally don't make any sense

[h1]Slot Machine Simulator[/h1]
[b]Pros:[/b] music.
[b]Cons:[/b] everything else.
[i]Mr. Mine[/i]? More like [i]Mr. Grind[/i].
A pay-to-wait simulator where even the drills move faster than your will to play.
waste of time
The progression sucks

Idle game that has a capacity that punishes you for being idle...
Also not being able to choose how much of an ore to sell with only the options of "all or nothing" is just stupid.
Game just wants you to spend money everywhere...
Also needs constant attention.

Mr.Mine could be better; As the game progresses it gets much, MUCH slower and afking is the only way to get things done (or buy premium). Coming back from being AFK feels like a chore with all the boxes to open - but don't stay AFK TOO long or you will run out of space. Just a big Nahhh from me - the game feels far too centered around pay up to speed up or else pay with your boredom - which is the opposite of what a game could be.

Like the game, but cost of ticket just ruin it. Scientist keep dying and it cost 7 tickets at time to revive them. I've lost three in one day all low risk jobs. Relics from the mine that give you buffs require slots that also cost tickets and go up each time you unlock one.

Co jsem se dostal za 4 hodiny, tak je to nudné. Je to jen idle, ale téměř žádná možnost tam něco dělat aktivně. Také interface je dost nepřehledný. Zbytek jako grafika je otázka vkusu a není to pro mě.

Huge paywall for new players.  Miners die, battle chests will not be offered, any meaningful number of tickets have to be paid for. 2 weeks 20hr in and have been stuck for a while. No way to get battle chests.

The upgrades are minuscule and with most of your time spent being staring at a screen waiting for something to happen, there needs to be more interaction. There are a lot of bugs-mostly visual, but some are outright annoying and nonsensical. This isn't an idle game; you have to be active. If you snooze, you lose-big time. Miss a mini-game and you can lose a week's progress. Upgrade prices are absurd: some items cost twenty times more than you can earn in a full day of play, even while using all buffs. Progress feels slow, even in mid-game, and the randomness can be frustrating.

Visually it's underwhelming-levels look very similar and feel like they were sketched in MS Paint. What's good: the mini-games, especially the cave system, are enjoyable, and you can earn in-game currency for free, which helps. Overall, the gameplay is okay, but the experience would be much better with bug fixes and some visual polish.

Edit: The game now stopped working properly. Assets are no longer loading. Right menu options are no longer clickeable. Even settings don't open. After last launch, the save now seems corrupted. I have no weapons, no super miners, scientists don't open any more. Overall it's a waste of time.

The upgrades are minuscule and with most of your time spent being staring at a screen waiting for something to happen, there needs to be more interaction. I get it's tagged "idle" but that's literally what you do. Glad I got out when I had only 10 hours and didn't waste more. If you are going to play this game, have a 2nd monitor. You wont ever do anything on it.

Not my thing.  Didn't change fast enough.  Wasn't complex enough.  Lots of repeated thoughts/actions.

Didn't make it super far though, so maybe I just didn't know where to look.

There are a lot of bugs-mostly visual, but some are outright annoying and nonsensical. This isn't an idle game; you have to be active. If you snooze, you lose-big time. Miss a mini-game and you can lose a week's progress. Upgrade prices are absurd: some items cost twenty times more than you can earn in a full day of play, even while using all buffs. Progress feels slow, even in mid-game, and the randomness can be frustrating.

Visually it's underwhelming-levels look very similar and feel like they were sketched in MS Paint. What's good: the mini-games, especially the cave system, are enjoyable, and you can earn in-game currency for free, which helps. Overall, the gameplay is okay, but the experience would be much better with bug fixes and some visual polish.

Edit: The game now stopped working properly. Assets are no longer loading. Right menu options are no longer clickeable. Even settings don't open. After last launch, the save now seems corrupted. I have no weapons, no super miners, scientists don't open any more. Overall it's a waste of time.
Earn 1k in game, get an offer to earn 50k to spam invite friends... Fuck that...
Graphics at the level of antediluvian drawings in Paint.
veeeeeery much on the idler side rather than the clicker side. if that's a turn off for you, then skip this.
Reactor literally don't make any sense

[h1]Slot Machine Simulator[/h1]
[b]Pros:[/b] music.
[b]Cons:[/b] everything else.
[i]Mr. Mine[/i]? More like [i]Mr. Grind[/i].
A pay-to-wait simulator where even the drills move faster than your will to play.
waste of time
The progression sucks

Idle game that has a capacity that punishes you for being idle...
Also not being able to choose how much of an ore to sell with only the options of "all or nothing" is just stupid.
Game just wants you to spend money everywhere...
Also needs constant attention.

Mr.Mine could be better; As the game progresses it gets much, MUCH slower and afking is the only way to get things done (or buy premium). Coming back from being AFK feels like a chore with all the boxes to open - but don't stay AFK TOO long or you will run out of space. Just a big Nahhh from me - the game feels far too centered around pay up to speed up or else pay with your boredom - which is the opposite of what a game could be.

Like the game, but cost of ticket just ruin it. Scientist keep dying and it cost 7 tickets at time to revive them. I've lost three in one day all low risk jobs. Relics from the mine that give you buffs require slots that also cost tickets and go up each time you unlock one.

Co jsem se dostal za 4 hodiny, tak je to nudné. Je to jen idle, ale téměř žádná možnost tam něco dělat aktivně. Také interface je dost nepřehledný. Zbytek jako grafika je otázka vkusu a není to pro mě.

Huge paywall for new players.  Miners die, battle chests will not be offered, any meaningful number of tickets have to be paid for. 2 weeks 20hr in and have been stuck for a while. No way to get battle chests.

It's a good incremental game, but I think it's too long of a grind for it to be even remotely rewarding. Most players in the discussion tend to have like 2-5 thousand hours. This time doesn't include offline gameplay. I don't mind devoting time like that to a game but all this game does is basically scroll. The upgrades are minuscule and with most of your time spent being staring at a screen waiting for something to happen, there needs to be more interaction. I get it's tagged "idle" but that's literally what you do. Glad I got out when I had only 10 hours and didn't waste more. If you are going to play this game, have a 2nd monitor. You wont ever do anything on it.

Not my thing.  Didn't change fast enough.  Wasn't complex enough.  Lots of repeated thoughts/actions.

Didn't make it super far though, so maybe I just didn't know where to look.
